background_dashed.customLabel: In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is a very strong effect in favor of  MUSIC on Overall ASD symptoms. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 9 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MUSIC and controls on Restricted/repetitive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of MUSIC on Social-communication. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 14 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MUSIC and controls on Social-communication. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MUSIC and controls on Adaptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  participants, there is a moderate-to-strong effect in favor of MUSIC on Language (Overall skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  participants, there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of MUSIC on Quality of life. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MUSIC and controls on Disruptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.
